chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nonah A. Gaertig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through w/ recommended treatment/counseling
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully complete sentence.

No contact w/ Antonio Hernandez and/or with drug users or sellers.
DOC agent must inspect the home of the defendant's mother to be sure it is appropriate for the defendant to reside in.
DOC agent can perform random drug testing on defendant.

Absolute sobriety.
No possession/consumption of controlled substance without valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia.

Court costs of $273 and DNA surcharge of $200 payable to COC office at the rate of $50/month commencing 11/27/2022.
Submit DNA sample.
Default of payment debt referred to SDC.
Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nonah A. Gaertig in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Nonah A. Gaertig.VWC Rachael Race in court. 
Court makes stmt charge has been amended to misdemeanor charge. Court reviews doc #13, PA,  efiled on 10/26/2022. Counsel and defendant understand offer/plea negotiations. State has filed amended complaint. Defendant has received a copy and understands charge and waives formal reading. Court reviews charge w/ defendant. Defendant enters plea of NO CONTEST. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court. Court finds defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis found. Adjudged guilty. Victim rights. No restitution claim. State makes stmt. State's recommendations. Atty Spansail heard. Court makes stmt. Defendant's grandmother makes stmt. Defendant's mother makes stmt. Defendant makes stmt. Court makes stmt.
Court sentence: Imposed/stayed 9 months county jail, 1 year DOC probation w/ conditions; AODA assessment and follow through w/ recommended treatment/counseling, absolute sobriety, no possession of controlled substance w/out valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia,  take all medication as prescribed, full time school and/or employment, no contact w/ Antonio Hernandez or with drug users or sellers, court costs of $273 and DNA surcharge of $200 payable to the COC at the rate of $50/month commencing 11/27/2022, submit DNA sample. 
Defendant may be released to her mother today, however, the Court wants the DOC agent to inspect the residence to be sure it is appropriate for the defendant to reside in. 
Agent can perform random drug testing on defendant. 
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence. 
Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation. 
Default of payment debt referred to SDC.
Expungement Review scheduled for October 27, 2023 at 07:00 am.
